butools.map.LagkJointMomentsFromMRAP

butools.map.RandomMMAP

butools.map.RandomMAP¶

butools.map.RandomMAP()¶
Matlab: [D0, D1] = RandomMAP(order, mean, zeroEntries, maxTrials, prec)
Mathematica: {D0, D1} = RandomMAP[order, mean, zeroEntries, maxTrials, prec]
Python/Numpy: D0, D1 = RandomMAP(order, mean, zeroEntries, maxTrials, prec)

Returns a random Markovian arrival process with given mean value.

Parameters:

order : int

The size of the MAP

mean : double, optional

The mean inter-arrival times of the MAP

zeroEntries : int, optional

The number of zero entries in the D0 and D1 matrices

maxTrials : int, optional

The maximum number of trials to find a proper MAP (that has an irreducible phase process and none of its parameters is all-zero)

prec : double, optional

Numerical precision for checking the irreducibility. The default value is 1e-14.
Returns:

D0 : vector, shape (1,M)

The D0 matrix of the MAP

D1 : matrix, shape (M,M)

The D1 matrix of the MAP

Examples

For Matlab:

>>> [D0,D1]=RandomMAP(4,1.62,10);
>>> D0
     -0.87934            0            0            0
            0      -1.2074      0.42836      0.25102
      0.11181            0     -0.69366      0.24076
      0.44849      0.42844      0.38088       -2.319
>>> D1
      0.38098      0.22325            0      0.27511
            0      0.39026            0      0.13776
            0            0      0.18773      0.15335
      0.12257      0.21414      0.53865      0.18586
>>> mean = MarginalMomentsFromMAP(D0,D1,1)
         1.62
>>> sum(sum((D0==0) + (D1==0)))
    10

For Python/Numpy:

>>> [D0,D1]=RandomMAP(4,1.62,10)
>>> print(D0)
[[-2.44519291  0.09402625  0.          0.61714559]
 [ 0.21556186 -1.32625847  0.04514016  0.        ]
 [ 0.39276582  0.0473513  -1.71036449  0.61975995]
 [ 0.          0.          0.47528295 -0.64305948]]
>>> print(D1)
[[ 0.4976004   0.43217453  0.50997245  0.29427367]
 [ 0.30269053  0.58347157  0.17939436  0.        ]
 [ 0.          0.24108537  0.          0.40940205]
 [ 0.16777654  0.          0.          0.        ]]
>>> print(MarginalMomentsFromMAP(D0,D1,1))
[1.6199999999999992]
>>> print(np.sum(D0==0) + np.sum(D1==0))
10
